347.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged by 10.1% in annual terms in September, which is the biggest jump in food prices since 1980. It matched the 40-year high, it hit in July, data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed on Wednesday. Prices of food and non-alcoholic beverages led the inflation in September as they rose by 14.5%.

348.title: Power cuts in parts of Bengaluru from October 20 to 22
348.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from October 20 to October 22 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. BESCOM divisions which will remain affected tomorrow are - Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Kengeri, Jalahalli, Peenya and Bagalakunte.

349.title: SpiceJet hikes salaries for captains to ₹7 lakh per month from November
349.article_body: SpiceJet has announced an increase in the salary for its captains with effect from November. The revised salary will amount to ₹7 lakh per month for 80 hours of flying, the airline said in an official statement. The low-cost carrier said that it has been revising salaries for its pilots on a monthly basis.

350.title: Mallikarjun Kharge becomes Congress' 1st non-Gandhi President in over 20 years
350.article_body: Mallikarjun Kharge became Congress' first non-Gandhi President in over two decades on Wednesday. Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress President poll which was held on Monday. Kharge will replace interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, who has been occupying the post ever since Rahul Gandhi stepped down after the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

351.title: Bilkis Bano case convict accused of molesting woman while out on parole in 2020
351.article_body: One of the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, 57-year-old Mitesh Bhatt, was accused of assaulting a woman with the intention of outraging her modesty when he was out on parole in June 2020, as per an affidavit of the Gujarat government. The 11 of them were released from prison on August 15 "on account of good behaviour".

352.title: 2nd phase of 'Mahakal Lok' project begins: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan
352.article_body: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said work on the second phase of the 'Mahakal Lok' project in MP’s Ujjain city has started. The work includes renovation of ancient temples and heritage structures and restoration of the Chhota Rudra Sagar lake, Chouhan added. After the completion of the second phase works, it will be transformed into “Shri Mahakal Mahalok", he stated.

353.title: Nestle India's Q3 profit rises 8.3% to ₹668 cr, revenue up 18.3%
353.article_body: Nestle India posted an 8.3% rise in net profit at ₹668 crore for the September quarter as against ₹617 crore a year ago. Its revenue surged 18.3% to ₹4,591 crore. It witnessed the highest sales growth during a quarter in the last five years. The Maggi-maker announced a second interim dividend of ₹120 per equity share amounting to ₹1,157 crore.

354.title: Kangana Ranaut to play theatre actor Noti Binodini in her next film
354.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut will be seen playing Bengali theatre superstar Noti Binodini in her upcoming film, which will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar. On Instagram, Kangana shared Binodini's picture and wrote that she "was the first female actress in British-occupied India" who "renounced everything and became a saint" after achieving success. "I'm very happy for this opportunity," Kangana added.

355.title: I'm seeing only Bhuvneshwar: Aakash on bowler Shami can replace in playing XI
355.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has suggested that Mohammad Shami can replace Bhuvneshwar Kumar in India's playing XI in the T20 World Cup. "Shami will definitely bowl better than Bhuvneshwar at the death...Harshal's form [is] fifty-fifty...[and] we have placed a lot of hope on Arshdeep, so maybe that's the only change I'm thinking of at this point in time," he explained.

356.title: Cyber criminals cheat woman over job in airline company in Pune
356.article_body: Cyber criminals cheated a woman over a false promise of a job in a private airline company in Pune, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters, including a woman, through a web portal in September 2020, Pimpri-Chinchwad Police added. The accused also asked the woman to transfer ₹11,500 into a bank account for the job.

357.title: Mumbai's Jagat Vidya road to be closed for 5 months starting today
357.article_body: The Jagat Vidya road in Mumbai's Kherwadi traffic division will be closed for five months in view of the drainage line work from Guru Nanak Hospital Chowk to the Bombay Bank Building. These arrangements will be in effect for five months from 12 am on October 19, 2022, to 12 am on March 18, 2023, the Mumbai Traffic Police said.

358.title: US to make it harder for Iran to sell drones to Russia with 'aggressive steps'
358.article_body: The US has said that it will continue to take "practical, aggressive" steps including sanctions and export control actions to make it harder for Iran to sell drones and missiles to Russia. "Russia deepening an alliance with Iran is something the entire world...should view as a profound threat," US State Department Principal Deputy Spokesperson Vedant Patel said.

359.title: Shashi Tharoor writes to Congress poll body, alleges 'serious irregularities' in UP
359.article_body: Shashi Tharoor has written to the Congress' Central Election Authority, alleging "extremely serious irregularities" in the conduct of the party's presidential election process in Uttar Pradesh. The letter stated problems like unofficial seals for ballot boxes, the presence of unofficial people in polling booths and voting malpractice. He added that "all votes from UP be deemed invalid."

360.title: Russian commander admits situation is 'tense' for his forces in Ukraine
360.article_body: The new commander of Russian forces in Ukraine said that the situation in the area of the 'Special Military Operation' can be described as "tense". Sergei Surovikin added that the current situation in Kherson is "very difficult" for both civilians and Russian soldiers. He also accused Ukraine of "deliberately striking infrastructure and residential buildings in Kherson".

361.title: Anurag Thakur flags off Mega Cleanliness Drive in Delhi’s Chandni Chowk
361.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday flagged off a Mega Cleanliness Drive in Delhi’s Chandni Chowk under Swachh Bharat 2022, which aims to collect one crore kg of plastic waste across the country. “We have already collected 84 lakh kg of plastic waste in a matter of 18 days and are set to surpass the target,” Thakur said.

362.title: Woman gang-raped, thrown on road in jute bag; rod inserted in private parts in UP
362.article_body: A woman from Delhi was allegedly gang-raped and tortured for two days after being kidnapped by five men in Ghaziabad. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal tweeted that a rod was inserted in the woman's private parts, adding that the men put her in jute bag and threw her on a road. Four of the accused have been arrested.

363.title: My first protective parental feeling was for Alia, Sidharth & Varun: Karan
363.article_body: Celebrating 10 years of 'Student of the Year', director Karan Johar shared that his "first protective parental feeling" was for Alia Bhatt, Varun Dhawan and Sidharth Malhotra. Karan said the 2012 film gave him three of his "most defining relationships". "Besides my mom, they are the three people I think I talk to every single day," Johar added.

364.title: Was very difficult scene for me: Amitabh on his iconic 'Deewaar' scene
364.article_body: On 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan shared that the iconic temple scene of 'Deewaar' "was very difficult" for him. He recalled that when Yash Chopra told him the shot was ready, he couldn't move out of his room. Amitabh also praised the writers for the film's script and his character's iconic dialogue - 'Aaj khush toh bahut hoge tum'.

365.title: Promise to dream deeper, work harder: Alia on 10 years in Bollywood
365.article_body: Bollywood actress Alia Bhatt, who completed 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, promised her fans to "be better, dream deeper and work harder". The actress, who made her Bollywood debut with 'Student of the Year', said she is "grateful every single day" for being a part of the film industry. "Thank you for the magic," she concluded.

366.title: Wipro Lighting celebrates Diwali the smart way: Wipro
366.article_body: Aiming to spread the message that traditions keep evolving but the festive spirit of Diwali remains the same, Wipro Lighting rolled out their Diwali film, sharing that it intricately captures the emotions of the festival in a #SurprisinglyHuman way. It revealed that the film begins with what feels like a scene from our households, and ends with a smart surprise.

367.title: I have spoken that it could be my last WC, but I don't know: Wade
367.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade has revealed that he never thought he would be playing another ICC event after the last year's T20 World Cup. "And now, I'm here again and I'm playing," said Wade. "I've spoken that it could be my last tournament, [but] I don't know...I just go in thinking every game is a bonus," he added.

368.title: 5 security guards of Gurugram society arrested for assaulting teen
368.article_body: As many as five security guards of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 49 have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 15-year-old boy, officials said. The boy had come to see a Diwali fair organised in the society and was allegedly abused and beaten up with sticks by the guards, police said. The accused are natives of UP and Rajasthan.

369.title: 4-yr-old girl raped by school principal's driver in Hyd; was being assaulted for 2 months
369.article_body: The driver of a kindergarten school's principal in Hyderabad was arrested by police on charges of sexually abusing a four-year-old student in the school. The girl told her mother that the assault had been going on for two months. As per reports, she was allegedly raped by the driver near the principal's chambers on Monday.

370.title: N Korea fires artillery shells to send 'grave warning' to S Korea
370.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday fired artillery shells off its eastern and western coasts, a day after South Korea began annual military drills aimed at boosting its ability to respond to Pyongyang's nuclear threats. North Korea said the shots were designed to send a "grave warning" to Seoul in response to its firing of dozens of artillery shells earlier on Tuesday.

371.title: Piramal Pharma makes trading debut at ₹200 apiece
371.article_body: Piramal Pharma Limited debuted on the National Stock Exchange at ₹200 apiece on Wednesday. The shares were listed at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma recently demerged from Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) and the demerger plan received the NCLT's approval on August 12. Piramal Pharma's stock was trading at ₹190.50 apiece at 11:25 am.

372.title: D2C brand ClearDekho raises $5 million in Series A funding round
372.article_body: D2C eyewear brand ClearDekho has secured $5 million in a Series A funding round led by Venture Catalysts and SphitiCap. The funding round also saw participation from Dholakia Ventures, NB Ventures, Estrela Ventures, Cornerstone, among others. In October 2021, the company had raised $4 million in a pre-Series A funding round from OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal-led Aroa Ventures, among others.

373.title: Green expressway to reduce travel time between Mumbai & B'luru to 5 hrs: Gadkari
373.article_body: The central government is planning a green expressway between Mumbai and Bengaluru that would cut down the travel time to five hours, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Similarly, the green expressway would shorten the travel time between Pune and Bengaluru to 3.5 to 4 hours, he added. Currently, it takes 12-15 hours to travel between Bengaluru and Mumbai.

374.title: Whoever wins, victory will be of Cong: Gehlot on party’s chief poll results
374.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential poll results, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said whoever wins the election, the victory will be of the party. Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge are the two candidates in the party's Presidential poll, held on October 17. "Experience doesn't have any alternative. Mallikarjun Kharge has a long experience. Shashi Tharoor has international experience," Gehlot said.

375.title: B'deshi Mathematics teacher compares Tharoor's hairline to quartic function; pic viral
375.article_body: A Bangladeshi Mathematics teacher compared Shashi Tharoor's hairline to a quartic function. Sharing a picture on Twitter, Tharoor wrote, "Letter received from Jalaj Chaturvedi: 'I believe that Mathematics should be taught beyond numbers. In Mathematical Modelling in grade 12, we explored that your hairline is a good quartic fit. Kindly see below & feel free to use it.'"

376.title: Scotland smash highest total of T20 World Cup 2022 so far
376.article_body: Scotland on Wednesday smashed the highest total of T20 World Cup 2022 so far by registering 176/5 against Ireland in their Round 1 match. They overtook Zimbabwe, who had put up a total of 174/7 against Ireland on Monday. Michael Jones top-scored for Scotland with 86(55), followed by captain Richie Berrington, who scored 37 runs off 27 deliveries.

377.title: Their tummies are visible, they can't move: Misbah-ul-Haq on Pakistan players
377.article_body: Criticising the fitness levels of Pakistan players, former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said, "Their tummies are visible, their lower [bodies] are heavy and they can't move." He added, "The reason behind this is there has not been a single fitness test, there is no benchmark." Pakistan will face India in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday.

378.title: Scotland's Michael Jones records highest score of T20 World Cup 2022
378.article_body: Scotland opener Michael Jones on Wednesday recorded the highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far. The 24-year-old scored 86 runs off 55 deliveries, including six fours and four sixes, against Ireland. The previous highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 was registered by Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza, who scored 82 runs off 48 deliveries against Ireland on Monday.

379.title: Goldman Sachs announces revamp after Q3 profit falls by 44%
379.article_body: After the Goldman Sachs Group reported a 44% slump in third-quarter profit, the company said it will reorganise its business into three units—asset and wealth management, global banking and markets and platform solutions. The company said its consumer unit will be folded into two separate businesses—wealth management and the newly-created platform solutions unit.

380.title: I didn't like being forced to be all looks: Meghan on 'Deal or No Deal'
380.article_body: In her podcast's latest episode, Meghan Markle recalled her time on 'Deal or No Deal' and remembered how she "didn't like feeling forced to be all looks". Sharing that there was a "very cookie-cutter idea" on how models were supposed to look, Meghan recalled that before the tapings, models would line up for lashes, extensions and padding in the bra.

381.title: Fill up 9,870 advertised primary teachers posts: SC to Haryana govt
381.article_body: Supreme Court directed the Haryana government to fill up the vacancies of primary teachers in the state. The 9,870 advertised posts should be filled up first from the candidates declared successful in the 2014 Haryana Teacher's Eligibility Test results, SC said. If the successful candidates don't join, fill up the remaining vacancies from the list of waitlisted candidates, SC added.

382.title: New Zealand Parliament proposes changes to counter-terrorism laws
382.article_body: New Zealand's Parliament has proposed changes to the Control Orders Act and the Terrorism Suppression Act to put more restrictions on people likely to be planning an attack. The changes include making it more difficult for those categorised to have the designation of "terrorist" removed. The step comes after a knife attack at an Auckland supermarket and Christchurch massacre.

383.title: Abhishek told me once, I agreed to do it: Amitabh on 'Uunchai'
383.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said his son Abhishek Bachchan asked him to be a part of Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai', which also stars Boman Irani and Anupam Kher, among others. "It's an honour for me that Sooraj ji gave me a chance to work in a film like 'Uunchai' with such great actors," he added. The film will release on November 11.

384.title: ISB bags top spot in Financial Times Global MBA 2022 ranking
384.article_body: ISB was ranked #1 in India and #4 in Asia in Financial Times Global MBA 2022 ranking. PGPpro, a weekend EMBA equivalent programme offered by ISB, aims to equip working professionals with the knowledge they need to become global leaders, ISB stated, adding that the programme provides flexibility to learn while working with cohorts in Bangalore, Delhi, Hyderabad & Mumbai.

385.title: With Suryakumar, India's batting strength has increased: Misbah
385.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq has said that Suryakumar Yadav has increased India's batting strength. "Overall, you can see that after last year's World Cup, India have decided to change their approach...they have taken an England-like policy, which is to just go after the bowling," added Misbah. Suryakumar has scored three fifties in his last five T20I innings.

386.title: Attrition at Amazon is costing the firm $8 bn annually, show leaked documents
386.article_body: Leaked internal documents showed that high attrition levels across its global consumer field operations were costing Amazon an estimated $8 billion annually. The documents claim that workers are twice as likely to leave by choice, rather than because they were fired. It showed that in 2021, only a third of new hires stayed with Amazon for more than 90 days.

387.title: Tata CLiQ CEO Vikas Purohit resigns: Reports
387.article_body: Tata CLiQ CEO Vikas Purohit has resigned from the e-commerce company, according to media reports and the announcement was made at a recent board meeting of the company. Purohit is said to have reportedly signed an offer from a multinational company in a non-competing sector to head its India business. Purohit had joined Tata CLiQ in November 2016.

388.title: I don't think Shaheen's return was as good as Shami's: Sanjay Bangar
388.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi's performance in their warm-up match against England wasn't as good as Mohammad Shami's impact in India's warm-up match against Australia. "I also feel Shaheen has made a slight change in his technique," added Bangar. Shaheen, who's making a comeback following his injury, conceded seven runs in his two overs.

389.title: Germany fires cybersecurity chief over alleged Russian ties
389.article_body: German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser on Tuesday fired the country's cybersecurity chief after media reports suggested that he had links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. Arne Schönbohm was the head of Federal Cyber Security Authority (BSI) since 2016. The German Interior Ministry said it has launched an investigation into the allegations against Schönbohm.

390.title: Hyd's Hussain Sagar Lake view to be blocked for next 4 months
390.article_body: The Hussain Sagar Lake view in Hyderabad will be blocked for next four months using barricades due to work related to the upcoming Formula E race in the city. These barricades will be removed after completion of the race. Black-topping will be done on the road around Hussain Sagar Lake and various safety tests of tracks will be carried out.

391.title: China blocks India-US move to list Lashkar-e-Taiba leader as global terrorist
391.article_body: China has blocked a proposal by India and the US at the United Nations to list Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba leader Shahid Mahmood as a global terrorist. This is the fourth time in as many months that China has put a hold on listing proposals to designate Pakistan-based terrorists under the 1267 Al Qaeda Sanctions Committee of the UN Security Council.

392.title: Will buy only if it is given on 'India rate': Pakistan on buying fuel from Russia
392.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Ishaq Dar who is on an official visit to the US has said that the country is ready to buy fuel from Russia if the same rate that India is paying is applicable to Pakistan as well. Dar also said that the West would have no problem with Pakistan importing discounted fuel.

393.title: Snake spotted in business class on US flight
393.article_body: A snake was spotted by a business class passenger on a flight from Florida to New Jersey. The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said in a statement that the airport's wildlife operations staff and Port Authority Police Department officers removed the garter snake from the United Airlines flight. No one was injured and operations were not affected.

394.title: Russia’s use of Iranian drones shows military bankruptcy: Zelenskyy
394.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia's dependence on Iran-made drones to attack Ukrainian targets shows the "Kremlin's military and political bankruptcy". Zelenskyy added that strategically, the move will not help Russia in any way and "further proves to the world that Russia is on the path of defeat and is trying to draw someone else into its accomplices in terror".

395.title: Special cells with attached bathrooms for VIP inmates in Mumbai jail soon
395.article_body: VIP inmates in Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail will soon be granted upgraded living quarters with facilities like adequate ventilation, western-style toilets, attached bathrooms and fans. They will also be given mattresses, bedsheets and served food in melamine crockery, prison authorities said. The newly upgraded living quarters will be handed over to the prison authorities by the end of October.

396.title: Iran to send missiles, drones to Russia including Shahed-136
396.article_body: Iran will provide Russia with surface-to-surface missiles and more drones, including Shahed-136, Reuters reported. Iran and Russia struck a deal on October 6 when senior Iranian officials visited Moscow. "Russia...asked for more drones and...Iranian ballistic missiles," an Iranian diplomat said. "Where they [weapons] are being used is not the seller's issue. We do not take sides," he added.

397.title: Idea of stardom has changed, now pan-India is new fad: Tamannaah
397.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia shared that in her view, the idea of stardom has changed and the term pan-India has become "a new phenomenon, a new fad". As per the actress, the concept of stardom ended with Amitabh Bachchan and Shah Rukh Khan. Tamannaah was last seen in 'Plan A Plan B' and Madhur Bhandarkar's 'Babli Bouncer'.

398.title: Man opens fire after buying luxury car in Mohali; booked after video goes viral
398.article_body: A builder's son was booked after opening fire in Mohali's Kharar on the purchase of a luxury car. He was booked when a video of him firing a gun in the air, while being surrounded by a cheering crowd, went viral online. The weapon used by the accused was not registered in his name but his friend's, police said.

399.title: India reports 1,946 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,968
399.article_body: India reported 1,946 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,542 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,968. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,923 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

400.title: SpaceX is losing $20 million/month on Starlink in Ukraine: Musk
400.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to reveal that the firm is losing approximately $20 million per month on Starlink in Ukraine due to "unpaid service and costs related to enhanced security measures for cyberwar defense". "But we will keep doing it," he added. Musk also claimed that the defense department has not given money for the service.

401.title: Govt plans to have helipads along new highways for emergency situations
401.article_body: The government is looking at having helipads along new national highways for immediate evacuation during emergencies. Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said the ministries of Civil Aviation and Road Transport have discussed the proposal. He was addressing the Civil Aviation Minister’s Conference. "All the new highways should have helipads…along them so that infrastructure is in place," he said.

402.title: Massive fire at pathology lab in Noida Sector 63 doused, no casualties
402.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a pathology lab in Noida's Sector 63 on Tuesday and it has been doused, officials said. "No casualty has been reported," Noida Fire Officer Jitender Kumar Singh said. The cause of the fire is not known yet. Earlier this month, a massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Noida Sector 3.
